title: Bottom navigation: prevent clipping and apply slight left shift

requirements.summary: Prevent the far-right Profile tab (icon + label) from being clipped on all screen sizes while respecting safe-area insets and avoiding horizontal scroll.
acceptanceCriteria: On Home/Trending/Create/Notifications/Profile routes, the Profile tab icon and label are fully visible (no clipping) at common viewport widths (mobile, tablet, desktop).
The bottom bar still respects safe-area insets (left/right/bottom) and remains fixed to the bottom without overlapping OS navigation areas.
No horizontal scrolling is introduced by the bottom tab bar.

file_operations.description: Adjust bottom tab bar layout to avoid overflow on narrow widths by reducing per-tab horizontal padding, using equal-width/flexing tab buttons (e.g., flex-1/min-w-0), and ensuring the nav/container does not cause horizontal overflow (e.g., overflow-x hidden/clip on the bar). Keep existing safe-area handling (left/right/bottom) and fixed positioning.

Extend existing bottom tab bar CSS variables to support robust spacing on small screens (e.g., introduce a dedicated variable for additional right-side breathing room / shift) without changing overall theme. Ensure changes are compatible with safe-area inset calculations already used by the bottom bar.

requirements.summary: Shift all bottom navigation tabs slightly to the left as a group while keeping spacing balanced and touch targets unchanged.
acceptanceCriteria: All five bottom tabs appear horizontally shifted left by a small, consistent amount (e.g., via asymmetric container padding/offset) without any single tab looking misaligned relative to the others.
After the shift, the Profile tab remains fully visible and is not closer than a reasonable touch-safe margin from the right edge/safe-area inset.
Tab hit areas remain comfortably tappable (no reduction in button size below current behavior).

file_operations.description: Apply a small, consistent left shift to the entire tab group using asymmetric container padding (e.g., slightly larger right padding than left) or a subtle translate on the inner container, while preserving safe-area inset padding and maintaining current/comfortable hit-area sizes.
Define/tune a single CSS variable controlling the bottom-tab group horizontal shift amount so it remains consistent across screen sizes and can be adjusted without changing component structure.
